alert.note: Alert for Caddo; Comanche (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 5:11AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Comanche and southeastern Caddo Counties through 545 AM CDT... At 511 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles west of Lake Ellsworth to near Fort Sill. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Northeastern Lawton, Elgin, Apache, Fletcher, Cyril, Sterling, Cement, Lake Ellsworth, Boone, eastern Fort Sill, and Stecker. This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 40 and 67. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
